section.title: isolated
section.para: Orphan code flag - indicates if the start or end marker of a spanning inline code is not in the same <unit> as its corresponding end or start code.
Value description: yes if this start or end code is not in the same <unit> as its corresponding end or start code, no if both codes are in the same <unit>.
section.programlisting: <file id="f2" xmlns:abc="urn:abc"> <unit id="1"> <mtc:matches> <mtc:match id="tc01" ref="seg2"> <source><sc id="1" isolated="yes"/>Warning:</source> <target><sc id="1" isolated="yes"/>Attention :</target> </mtc:match> </mtc:matches> <segment id="seg2"> <source><pc id="1">Warning: File not found.</pc></source> </segment> </unit> </file>
section.para: In the example above the <sc> elements have their isolated attribute set to yes because they do not have their corresponding <ec> elements.
